it.ismb.pertlab.ogc.sensorthings.api.datamodel

Class Observation

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.ismb.pertlab.ogc.sensorthings.api.datamodel.Observation

  • public class Observation
extends Object
    Definition: An act of observing a property or phenomenon on a feature of interest, with the goal of producing an estimate of the value of the property. A specialized event whose result is a data value. [OGC 07-022r1].
    Author:
    Dario Bonino

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Observation()
      Empty constructor, implements the bean instantiation pattern

    • Constructor Detail

      • Observation

        public Observation()
        Empty constructor, implements the bean instantiation pattern

    • Method Detail

      • getPhenomenonTime

        public Date getPhenomenonTime()
        Returns The time point/period of when the observation happens. In string representations this is typically rendered as ISO8601 time point/period string.
        Returns:
        the phenomenonTime as a Date object

      • setPhenomenonTime

        public void setPhenomenonTime(Date phenomenonTime)
        Sets time point/period of when the observation happens.
        Parameters:
        phenomenonTime - the phenomenonTime to set, as a Date instance.

      • getResultValue

        public Object getResultValue()
        Provides the estimated value of an observedProperty from the observation. This is intended as a Measure with value and unit (e.g., javax.measure.DecimalMeasure).
        Returns:
        the resultValue The value as an Object (typically a javax.measure.DecimalMeasure)

      • setResultValue

        public void setResultValue(Object resultValue)
        Sets the estimated value of an observedProperty from the observation. This is intended as a Measure with value and unit (e.g., javax.measure.DecimalMeasure).
        Parameters:
        resultValue - the resultValue to set, typically a javax.measure.DecimalMeasure

      • getResultType

        public Object getResultType()
        Provides the data type of the ResultValue. Service should by default set the ResultType as \"Measure\" unless users specify a different ResultType when creating an observation.
        Returns:
        the resultType The type of the observation as an Object.

      • setResultType

        public void setResultType(Object resultType)
        Sets the data type of the ResultValue.Typical adoption is: 
         // the temperature value as a measure
 DecimalMeasure<Temperature> temperature = DecimalMeasure.valueOf(binMetric.getTemperature() + " "
                + SI.CELSIUS.toString());
 
 // the corresponding observation
 Observation obs = new Observation();
 
 // set the observation type
 obs.setResultType(temperature.getClass().getSimpleName());
 
 // can also be done as follows
 obs.setResultType(temperature.getClass()) //but would not be easy to Jsonify
        Parameters:
        resultType - the resultType to set

      • getDatastream

        public Datastream getDatastream()
        Provides the Datastream instance to which this observation belongs.
        Returns:
        the datastream including this observation.

      • setDatastream

        public void setDatastream(Datastream datastream)
        Sets the Datastream instance to which this observation belongs.
        Parameters:
        datastream - the datastream to which the observation must be associated.

      • getFeatureOfInterest

        public FeatureOfInterest getFeatureOfInterest()
        Provides the FeatureOfInterest about "described" by this observation.
        Returns:
        the featureOfInterest described by this observation.

      • setFeatureOfInterest

        public void setFeatureOfInterest(FeatureOfInterest featureOfInterest)
        Sets the FeatureOfInterest about "described" by this observation.
        Parameters:
        featureOfInterest - the featureOfInterest to which this observation refers.

      • getSensor

        public Sensor getSensor()
        Provides the Sensor instance generating this observation
        Returns:
        the sensor

      • setSensor

        public void setSensor(Sensor sensor)
        Sets the Sensor instance generating this observation
        Parameters:
        sensor - the sensor to set
